column3: Despite your best efforts, you fail to locate a confluence of aether or any pieces of magicite...
Well, well, if it isn't the hero of the Resistance. I suppose I shouldn't be surprised that you are capable of holding your own this far from Port Surgate.
I came to this dreadful place to investigate a disturbance in the aetherial currents. Perchance you would be so kind as to tell me your reason for being here as well?

So this magicite you seek was the cause of these confluences, was it? I see... Glad to hear that Krile is still capable of conducting the most rudimentary research. I thank you for sharing with me your findings.
I shall share with you mine own discovery by way of gratitude. I believe this is the stone you were looking for?
Keep it. I have no use for such baubles. Consider it payment for your information, if you prefer.
This island was ever filled with danger and death. Despite its once-close proximity to the motherland, no one bothered to settle it for that very reason.
Circumventing these hazards was one of the reasons the Students devoted so many resources to the construction of an expansive Aethernet...
...Restoring it is an admirable endeavor, and I wish you and Krile the best of luck in it. You may tell her I said as much.
However, I still intend to find my own way to return to our headquarters. Go well, adventurer. I shall find you again if I have information to share.
On closer inspection, the stone you received from Ejika does indeed appear to be another piece of magicite...
The magicite you have obtained may be used in conjunction with your magia board.
